Ok, I have seen that niche SN are now becoming the rage amonst startup circles. [Social Savanna](https://socialsavanna.com/) being the one for imgur is quite successful.
Personally I feel that FCC lends itself perfectly to a social network.
The ability to form groups, spark new ideas and friend people from Gitter, track progress will go along way to attracting even more popularity for FCC
at the beginning
this ia social network for FCC memebers mainly
@BerkeleyTrue Yeah, it's a niche network targeting developers. We want to make unique features that target that demographic. I've also seen other niche social networks succeed.
What are your competitors? (other then fb, twit) I seem to remember meeting a founder who created a social network for developers
adn since there's a very social atmosphere at FCC with the chat and stuff
Right, there isn't really any serious social network for developers
@BerkeleyTrue We want it to be more focused for developers. Similar to how Gitter is a chat service focused for Github users
That's a thought. We were considering targeting other dev groups after FCC so we could work on github Oath
So let me ask, why another social network? Have y’all seen a demand from campers? Is this something you all wanted to tackle for fun?
Thank you for your assistance Berkeley.
Okay, sounds like we have a tentative plan : )
It will most likely be Oauth 2.0 (it be cool to use JWT’s but not sure how combatible that is with current 2.0 standard)
true

So, I'm sure we can start without it, but we do want the auth in the proto so people can test it out easily
ALthough, I think oauth might be something one of this group can takle with guidance.

That may be a problem There are two major features for FCC that need to come out before I can work out the details for this. One is almost done, the second should take  me a week if I can dedicate full-time (currently taking care of a parent while they recover from knee surgery)

"WebTorrent is a streaming torrent client for node.js and the browser. YEP, THAT'S RIGHT. THE BROWSER. It's written completely in JavaScript – the language of the web – so the same code works in both runtimes.

In node.js, this module is a simple torrent client, using TCP and UDP to talk to other torrent clients.

In the browser, WebTorrent uses WebRTC (data channels) for peer-to-peer transport. It can be used without browser plugins, extensions, or installations. It's Just JavaScript™."
